properties.areaDesc: Anchorage; Susitna Valley; Matanuska Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 1:37AM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
A very strong cold front moving up Cook Inlet will bring back
winter in a hurry this evening and tonight as temperatures plummet
rapidly and snow begins to accumulate from the southern Kenai
Peninsula northward to the Matanuska Valley. In the afternoon,
strong southwest winds and extremely cold arctic air will impact
Kachemak Bay and the southern Kenai, and this will support areas
of blizzard conditions given the ocean-enhanced snow showers
forming along Cook Inlet. By late evening, expect heavy snow to be
impacting areas from Anchorage to the Matanuska Valley. The
combination of rapidly cooling temperatures and periods of heavy
snow will likely result in potentially hazardous travel conditions
as this colder air quickly moves into the Susitna Valley and
Copper Basin by Wednesday morning as temps fall throughout the day
across all of Southcentral.

NWSheadline: HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE COOK INLET REGION
